newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean won finishes lower on firmer dlr/yen.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean won finishes lower on firmer dlr/yen.

text.p: The won closed lower versus the dollar on Monday as stronger dollar against the Japanese yen on the world markets prompted dollar short-covering in the afternoon, traders said.
The won closed at 828.20 after opening at 827.70. It moved in a range of 827.10 to 828.60.
Dealers said the won started to lose strength in the afternoon after remaining in balance in a tight range of 827.10 to 828.00 in the early trading.
"Although there were fewer than expected import deals, they still outnumbered export negotiations," said a local dealer.
Traders said the won was likely to remain weak on Tuesday on a market talk that won liquidity situation in the money market is seen better than expected.
Banks will have to meet their reserve requirement deadline on Tuesday.
They forecast a range of 827.50 to 829.00 for Tuesday with a base mid-rate of 827.80. Today's mid-rate was pegged at 827.30.
